title: Inside Design a Review: 40 Years of Work
description: Morton Goldsholl (1911-1995) was a lifelong resident of Chicago, where he studied at the Chicago Institute of Art and the Institute of Design and, in 1955, formed Morton Goldsholl Associates. He was a faculty member at The Abraham Lincoln School for Social Sciences, the educational institution run by the Communist Party USA. Goldsholl carved out his niche with corporate identity programs, packaging, and animated commercials, and produced the Good Design Logo for the Merchandise Mart and the Museum of Modern Art in 1950.

title: Alexey Brodovitch
description: This book is a comprehensive monograph on Brodovitch's life and work, drawing from interviews with a wide spectrum of colleagues and collaborators - and assimilating previously unpublished material from archives and private collections around the world - to offer an in-depth analysis and appreciation of Brodovitch's unique and lasting contribution to the visual arts.

title: Impaginazione Grafica 67/68
description: Portfolio of graphics and advertising related to publishing and advertising art, with overprint.

title: Trademarks and Symbols of the World
description: Includes 5,800 trademarks, service marks, symbols etc. by 1,300 designers from 38 countries. Featuring work by Saul Bass, Anton Stankowski, Paul Rand, Lester Beall, Giuli Confalonieri, and Earnst Roch. Preface by Paul Rand.

title: Trademarks & Symbols Volume 1: Alphabetical Designs
description: A comprehensive, profusely illustrated guide to more than 1,500 trademarks from all over the world. The trademark designs in this volume are based on letter forms and arranged alphabetically.

title: Trademarks & Symbols Volume 2: Symbolical Designs
description: A comprehensive, profusely illustrated guide to more than 1,500 trademarks from all over the world. The trademark designs in this volume are based on symbol forms and arranged stylistically.

title: Design of the Fifties in Croatia
description: Interior design, architecture, posters, and graphic design.

title: Polski Plakat Filmowy

title: German Advertising Art
tags: german, logos, stamps, book jackets, calendars
description: This book contains bold German advertising, logos, magazine covers, book jackets, stamps and calendars. In English.

title: Logo Art
description: Examples of unique and thoughtful lettering and typography.

title: Nippon Design Center
description: Nippon Design Center, founded in 1960 by Kamekura Yusaku and Hara Rira participated. This book celebrates its 5th and 10th anniversaries, a set of works published as not for sale. In addition to the ”Tokyo Olympic Posters” by Kamekura, advertisement series, calendar, book design, trademark etc. of ”International Print Biennale” poster (Kazumitsu Tanaka), Sapporo Olympic logo, ”Toyota” ”Asahi Beer” ”Toshiba” We introduce a variety of works. Text is Hara and others.

title: Official Graphic Art in Switzerland
description: The first, comprehensive look at contemporary (1964) publicity in Switzerland as it relates to the Federal Government (i.e. Railways, Post, Telephone, National Exhibition, Industrial Fair, Transport Museum, Tourist Office, Red Cross, Lottery, International Motor Show, Swissair, etc.). Illustrated with more than 375 b/w (and some color) examples of Swiss modern typography including stationary, posters, booklets, brochures and more.

title: Graphic Art of A Swiss Town
description: Documenting the rich, visual development for the city of Zürich. Profusely illustrated in b/w (some color) with examples of printed matter including: stationary, posters, programs, reports and more. Part of the comprehensive ABC Verlag series.

title: Publicité 11
description: A review of advertising and graphic art in Switzerland. Includes work by Christoph Aeppli, Charles Affolter, Herbert Auchli, Roland Bartsch, Pierre Bataillard, Fred Bauer, Walter Bosshart, Donald Brun, Paul Buhlmann, Georges Calame, Walter Diethelm, Hans Erni, Karl Gerstner, Otto Glaser, Carl Graf, Hans Hartmann, Armin Hofmann, Othmar Jaeggi, Kurt Jordi, Pal Kolozsvari, Ruedi Kulling, Herbert Leupin, Raymond Loewy, Richard P. Lohse, Hans Looser, Lukas Martz, Erwin Meirerhofer, Pierre Monnerat, Fridolin Muller, Josef Muller-Brockmann, Hans Neuburg, Siegfried Odermatt, Hans Pfister, Celestino Piatti, Nelly Pieren, Heinrich Steiner, Franz Studer, Kurt Wirth, Marcel Wyss, and many, many others.

title: Publicité 8
description: A review of advertising and graphic art in Switzerland. Includes work by Walter Bangeter, Donald Brun, Fritz Buhler, Eric Fraser, Otto Glaser, Hans Hartmann, Warja + Gottfried Honegger-Lavater, Herbert Leupin, Richard Lohse, Walter Niggli, Henri Ott, Celestino Piatti, Peter Schmidlin, Carlo Vivarelli, Kurt Wirth and many, many others.

title: Publicité 13
description: A review of advertising and graphic art in Switzerland.

E. Wuttke, and Wolf D. Zimmermann.

title: Pintori (2003 Museo d’arte provincia di nuoro)
Thoughts on Design
description: One of the seminal texts of graphic design, Paul Rand's Thoughts on Design is now available for the first time since the 1970s. Writing at the height of his career, Rand articulated in his slender volume the pioneering vision that all design should seamlessly integrate form and function. This facsimile edition preserves Rand's original 1947 essay with the adjustments he made to its text and imagery for a revised printing in 1970, and adds only an informative and inspiring new foreword by design luminary Michael Bierut. As relevant today as it was when first published, this classic treatise is an indispensable addition to the library of every designer. - summary: fun, eyeopening, classic

title: Graphic Design Manual
description: Armin Hofmann’s richly varied work is recognized for its reliance on the fundamental elements of graphic form – point, line, and form. The book was originally a fundamentally new attempt to provide a methodical approach to challenges of graphic design. Elements of image and form are analyzed and examined with regard to their inherent laws. The thoroughly revised edition of the 1965 design manual classic includes new sections that adapt his thoughts to contemporary technological uses. Especially in times of the return to clear and minimalistic geometric forms and patterns, his rich body of work serves as a perfect starting point for contemporary design practices.

title: Due Dimensioni Vol 2
description: A catalog of Italian designers: Augusto Avanzi, Walter Ballmer, Roberta Balocco, Horst Blachian, Maddalena Buchwald, Titti Fabiani, Max Huber, Giancarlo Iliprandi, Laura Micheletto, Bruno Munari, Anna Sironi, Gino Sironi, Pino Trovaglia, Walter Valentini, Heinz Waibl, Paolo Zanussi. Foreword by Bruno Munari.

description: Instead of learning to use magic wisely, the sorcerer's apprentice uses it to get out of doing chores. Translated from Japanese.

title: Peter Petrake
description: Serialized comic series about Peter Petrake, a parody of James Bond. Written in Spanish.

title: Das Liederkarussell
description: Das Liederkarussell is a children’s songbook that translates from German into The Carousel.

title: The Happy Owls
description: Words by Theo van Hoijtema. “You can draw an Owl a thousand times, and never find out it's secret.” —Celestino Piatti, 1992

title: The Teletrips of Alala
description: Here, in living color, is the story of Alala, tomorrow's child. Meet her hip parents, Rodolphe and Anna d'Alcantara, and her best friends, a toothbrush and a turntable, both of which talk (and in several languages!). Join the menange as they float to exotic places on their plastic, deflatable house.

title: Musicians of the World
description: Traces the history of musicians from the first prehistoric musicians of Africa to the rock musicians of the present day.

title: Pubblicità in Italia 1958–1959
description: “Advertising in Italy” is an accurate look at Italian graphic design in 1958-59 including: posters, advertising, catalogs, packaging, trade-marks and more. Designed by Franco Grignani.

title: Radio and Television Publicity
description:
“To the almost unlimited and often unrealized potentialities of radio and television advertising, Erberto Carboni brings all the ingenuity and dramatic flair which have made him a brilliant leader in the exciting Italian school of modern design.”
A visually stunning book that spotlights the relatively unknown Carboni’s work in from the early 1930s through the late 1950s. This book is a valuable resource because it traces the development of one of Italy's finest modernists through tightly focused case studies of his publicity work for the emerging Italian mass media.  It is a true joy to see complete campaigns reproduced in full.
With an introduction by Gio Ponti.
